byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ahmad Shakib, Fazal Muzhary and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, and Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan.

abstract: Taliban take territory across three provinces in northern Afghanistan, as government tries to support isolated outposts; more than 100 police in north surrender and more than thousands men retreat.
lead_paragraph: Over 100 police officers and other security personnel in the north have surrendered to the militants in the campaign, and scores of others have retreated.

headline.main: Taliban Make Gains Across 3 Provinces in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Taliban Make Gains Across 3 Provinces in Afghanistan

snippet: Over 100 police officers and other security personnel in the north have surrendered to the militants in the campaign, and scores of others have retreated.
